intro: Critesion simulans, commonly known as the false buttonweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetland areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, forming a rounded head that resembles a button. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
